questions.content:
Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct word or phrase that best fits each of the blanks

I began my teaching career nearly ten years ago. I …….. six years teaching in a remote village where the villagers were very poor and the living standard was low. Sometimes I was very …….because of bad living condition and low pay. I was really homesick;………, at that time, with my youth enthusiasm, I tried my best to devote myself to the noblest career which was "teaching". I loved my poor little students. They were living in poverty, but they could not suffer from empty mind.

I am proud ..................... myself to be a teacher, a hard working "boatman" taking my students to the "destination" of ............................

answers.content: spent
had
gave
took
disappointedly
disappointed
disappointing
disappoint
but
therefore
and
however
in
of
about
on
knowledge
experience
competence
assistance

questions.content:
Read the following passage and mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the correct answer to each of the questions

Parents often have dreams for their children’s future. They hope their children will have a better life than they had. They dream that their children will do things that they couldn’t do. Parents who come to the U.S from foreign countries hope their children will have better education here. They think their children will have more career choices and more successful lives. They make many sacrifices so that their children will have more opportunities. They think their children will remain close to them because of these sacrifices. Some children understand and appreciate these sacrifices and remain close to their parents. However, other children feel ashamed that their parents are so different from other Americans.
What is the main idea of the passage?

answers.content: Their children will make a lot of money in the future
Parents want their children to become famous people
Parents hope to live on their children’s money in the future
Parents dream of a bright future for their children

questions.content: The word “They” in line 3 refers to……………….

answers.content: dreams
children
parents
countries

questions.content: Parents think their children will remain close to them because……………….

answers.content: they know their children will be successful in the future
they are living in a foreign country
they give their children a lot of money
they offer sacrifice to their children

questions.content: The word career in line 3 is closest in meaning to………………..

answers.content: travel
subject
job
chance

questions.content: Which of the following statement is true according to the passage?

answers.content: The parents think that the US has better education.
They don’t make many sacrifices so that their children will have more opportunities.
No one of their children understands and appreciates these sacrifices.
They think their children will not remain close to them because of these sacrifices.

questions.content: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that is CLOSEST in meaning to the sentence given in each of the following questions.
Mr. Long smoked a lot in his office, but he doesn't any more.

answers.content: Mr. Long didn’t use to smoke a lot in his office.
Mr. Long used to smoke a lot in his office.
Mr. Long uses to smoke a lot in his office.
Mr. Long wants to smoke a lot in his office.

questions.content: Our team has just completed an important project.

answers.content: An important project has just completed by our team.
An important project been has just completed by our team.
An important project has just been completed by our team.
Our team has just been completed by an important project.

questions.content: It was raining heavily, so we cancelled the picnic to the countryside last weekend.

answers.content: Because it was raining heavily, we continued the picnic to the countryside last weekend.
Although it was raining heavily, we cancelled the picnic to the countryside last weekend.
Because of it was raining heavily we cancelled the picnic to the countryside last weekend.
Because it was raining heavily, we cancelled the picnic to the countryside last weekend.

questions.content: Mark the letter A, B, C, or D on your answer sheet to indicate the sentence that best combines each pair of sentences in the following sentences.
The teamhas won the championship. This makes its fan feel extremely excited and proud.

answers.content: The team has won the championship makes its fan feel extremely excited and proud.
The team has won the championship, which makes its fan feel extremely excited and proud.
The team has won the championship, makes its fan feel extremely excited and proud.
The team has won the championship who makes its fan feel extremely excited and proud.

questions.content: The police are looking for the man. We met him at the cinema last night.

answers.content: The police are looking for the man that we met him at the cinema last night.
The police are looking for the man which we met at the cinema last night.
The police are looking for the man whom we met at the cinema last night.

The police are looking for the man we met who at the cinema last night.

.
